net.sf.opengroove.client
Class OpenGroove

java.lang.Object
  net.sf.opengroove.client.OpenGroove

public class OpenGroove
extends Object

This is the class that does most of the thinking for Convergia. If you don't want Convergia to update itself (for example, if you are developing it), then you would run this class. If you do want Convergia to update itself, you would call Loader, which then calls this class after a bit of processing related to updates.

Author:
Alexander Boyd

userContextMap

public static final Hashtable<String,UserContext> userContextMap
Each user that is currently logged in has an entry in this map. The keys are userids and the values are user contexts that correspond to that user.

SECURITY_KEY_SIZE

public static final int SECURITY_KEY_SIZE
The number of bits that should be in RSA security keys generated for the user. Workspace key sizes are decided by the creator of the workspace, but default to this value as well.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

INTERNAL_HELP_FOLDER

public static final File INTERNAL_HELP_FOLDER
Each user has their own help folder, which can be retrieved via the Storage.getHelpStore() method. This folder (the one in this field, not the one in the method previously mentioned) contains the built-in help files that should be copied over to the user's own help folder upon OpenGroove startup. This makes it so that each user has the internal help pages, as well as any help pages provided by the user's server and the user's plugins.

Method Detail

getWindowIcon

public static Image getWindowIcon()
This is the icon that should be used as the icon for all Convergia windows, as well as the tray icon.

Returns:

restartOpenGroove

public static void restartOpenGroove(Window parent)
restarts OpenGroove. This method takes a few seconds to run before terminating this vm. This method should never return normally. It also doesn't ask the user if they want to save changes to anything, although in the future some sort of API for allowing things to register something like ExitingListeners that check to see if it's ok to exit and save if necessary could be added.

Parameters:
parent - The window that should be used as the parent of any dialogs that report error messages. This can be null, but it's highly recommended not to do so.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws Throwable
Starts OpenGroove, without updates. Run the main method of net.sf.opengroove.client.Loader if you want OpenGroove to update itself.

Parameters:
args -
Throws:
Throwable

blockTransparify

private static BufferedImage blockTransparify(BufferedImage oldImage,
                                              Color color)
Changes all pixels in the image that are within five color points of the color specified to transparent. The image passed in is copied before any of the transparifying occurs.

Parameters:
image - The image to transparify
color - The color to convert to transparent
Returns:
A new image with transparency applied

showChosenLaunchbar

protected static void showChosenLaunchbar()
If no users are logged in, this method does nothing. If only one user is logged in, this method shows that user's launchbar. If more than one user is logged in, this method shows a dialog asking the user to pick which launchbar they want to show. This dialog will hide itself if it loses focus.

doFrameLogin

protected static void doFrameLogin()
This methods is called when the user clicks the "login" button in the login window. It validates their password (if it's incorrect, a message is shown on the login frame and this method returns) and creates a user context for them. It then does stuff like setting up a launchbar for them, refreshing the taskbar menu, etc.

refreshTrayMenu

public static void refreshTrayMenu()
Refreshes the task tray menu. This involves removing all items from it, and adding items back as they currently should be.

showLoginWindow

public static void showLoginWindow(String userid)
Shows the login window for the specified user. If the login window is already showing, it is changed to this user. If this user is already logged in, this method does nothing. If this user does not exist, or the userid is null, the new account wizard is shown instead.

If the new user wizard is currently showing, it is brought to the front, and this method returns.

Parameters:
userid -

initLoginFrame

private static void initLoginFrame()

showLoginFrame

private static void showLoginFrame(String userid)

initNewAccountWizard

private static void initNewAccountWizard()

showNewAccountWizard

private static void showNewAccountWizard(boolean welcome)
Shows the new account wizard. If the wizard is already showing, it will be brought to the front. If not, the current wizard page will be reset to it's first page. If welcome is true, the wizard will have an added initial screen that gives the user more information about OpenGroove. If not, this initial screen won't be displayed, and the first screen will instead be the one that allows users to choose between creating a new account, importing one they have already created, or entering an account configuration code. If the user finishes the wizard successfully, the login box will be shown.

getWelcomeWizardMessage

protected static String getWelcomeWizardMessage()

anyServerConnections

protected static boolean anyServerConnections()

loadFeatures

private static void loadFeatures()
Loads all of the feature plugins and gets them up and running. The PluginManager is responsible for actually loading the feature classes, but the feature manager initializes them.

initAboutWindow

protected static void initAboutWindow()

showAboutWindow

protected static void showAboutWindow()
Shows an about window that describes OpenGroove and it's current version. In the future, this will also show the about screens for any plugins that have an about screen.

checkForUpdates

public static boolean checkForUpdates()
checks for updates to OpenGroove, and downloads them if available. In the future, this will be changed so that the user can choose whether to download them automatically or prompt the user first. It will also be changed to show a changelog to the user.

Returns:

w -

getDisplayableVersion

protected static String getDisplayableVersion()
gets a string that represents the version of OpenGroove.

Returns:

exit

protected static void exit()
Exits OpenGroove. currently, this just calls System.exit(0), but it will check for unsaved changes (via an API to register ExitingListeners or such) in the future.

showLaunchBar

protected static void showLaunchBar(UserContext context)
shows the launchbar. If it's not showing (IE hidden) it will be shown. If it's showing, it will be focused. This method does not deiconify the window right now, this will be added later.

loadLaunchBar

private static void loadLaunchBar(String userid,
                                  UserContext context)
Loads the launchbar. This is called for each user when they log in.

findNewPlugins

public static void findNewPlugins(JFrame frame,
                                  UserContext context)
shows a dialog to the user where they can select plugins from the ptl to download. (ptl stands for Public Tool List, which is somewhat of a misnomer because it contains lots of types of plugins, not just tools) this method will return once the user has closed the dialog.

Parameters:
frame - the frame to pass to the dialog's constructor. the dialog will be shown on top of this frame.
context - The user context of the user that wants to search for new plugins.

showOptionsWindow

protected static void showOptionsWindow(UserContext context)
Shows a dialog that allows the user to configure OpenGroove.

showStatusInfo

private static void showStatusInfo(UserContext context,
                                   ConfigureOpenGrooveDialog dialog)
adds status concerning OpenGroove's connectivity to the ConfigureOpenGrooveDialog specified. This needs to be made less hard-coded, and will change significantly with the addition of realm servers.

Parameters:
dialog -

showWelcomeToInTouchScreen

private static void showWelcomeToInTouchScreen()
Shows a screen welcoming the user to OpenGroove. This is obsolete, and will be replaced by the wizard-style introduction that is coming with the addition of realm servers.

generateId

public static String generateId(UserContext context)
creates a new id. the id should be unique for the whole OpenGroove system. the first part of the id, up until the first hyphen, is this user's userid, with the ":" character replaced by two dots, IE ".." .

Returns:

showConfigWindow

public static boolean showConfigWindow(UserContext context,
                                       WorkspaceWrapper workspace,
                                       JFrame frame)
shows the config window for a specified workspace. if there is currently a dialog showing (IE another config dialog, create workspace, import workspace, etc) then false is returned and the config dialog is not shown. if there is no current dialog, true is returned almost immediately, IE the dialog is shown in a separate thread so this thread does not block while the dialog is showing.

Parameters:
workspace -
frame -
Returns:

allowedMembersModel -

delimited

public static String delimited(List<String> items,
                               String delimiter)
returns a string containing each of the items in the list specified, separated by delimiter. if there are no items, the empty string is returned. this method is designed to be approximately the opposite of String.split, except that split uses regex instead of literal strings.

Parameters:
items -
delimiter -
Returns:

formatDataSize

public static String formatDataSize(double size)
returns a formatted string indicating the size of the data specified. String look like 1B, 500B, 350KB, 250GB, etc. Strings only go up to gigabytes, so 2 terabytes (2000 gigabytes) shows up as 2000GB.

Parameters:
size -
Returns:

saveJarFile

public static void saveJarFile(File target,
                               JarFile source,
                               Manifest mf)

longRename

public static void longRename(File src,
                              File target)
                       throws IOException
renames the source file to the target file, but using pure java to do so as opposed to the File.renameTo() method. It essentially opens a FileInputStream and FileOutputStream for the source and target files, streams the data from one to the other, and then deletes the source file.

Parameters:
src -
target -
Throws:
IOException
